item.title: Alcohol is not the answer. It just makes you forget the question.
item.description: Alcohol is not the answer. It just makes you forget the question.

item.title: How One Second Could Cost Amazon $1.6 Billion In Sales
item.description:
How One Second Could Cost Amazon $1.6 Billion In Sales

The data comes from an infographic compiled by OnlineGraduatePrograms.com, with the specific goal of finding out about tolerance of slow webpage speeds for the average U.S. web user. Then they extended the data to cover other habits that take time, like waiting in line or being served in a restaurant.

item.title: Work with templates, not against them
Graphic Design
item.description:
Graphic Design

1. Canva

Almost everybody knows Canva, but I'm still including it as a hack for those who don't know about it yet. It's great for quick graphics and inspiration. With Canva for work, you get the convenience of having consistent visuals. But if you prefer to use it for free, check out Design Feed (a tool I've classified under social media due to its main purpose of providing ease for generating social media graphics).

item.title: Creative Business Resources
item.description:
Creative Business Resources

For the past few years, I've realised that for creatives (web designers, graphic designers, photographers, copywriters and writers), starting a business is tougher than anything else I've ever attempted in my life.

item.title: "Ding, Ding, Ding! You Can Have Fun Now!"
item.description:
"Ding, Ding, Ding! You Can Have Fun Now!"

I'm going to England tomorrow. By which I mean I'm stepping inside a long metal torpedo and sitting my fat ass down on some murky blue pleather for an exact distance of 5,429 miles across a cold, dreary ocean that always makes me wonder things I shouldn't ever wonder.

item.title: Better Than First: The Singapore Airlines Suite Class Experience
How We Earned Frequent Flyer Miles To Get First Class Tickets...And Better
item.description:
How We Earned Frequent Flyer Miles To Get First Class Tickets...And Better

In my last post, I wrote about our once-in-a-lifetime suite class flight experience with Singapore Airlines.

item.title: How To Set Boundaries
item.description: Whether in business or personal life, one of the biggest problems that we face is how to say no. In such a noisy world with so many things happening, we have the tendency to not want to miss out, and so the word NO becomes almost hard to pronounce. As young kids, we were taught to be nice, but somehow, someone forgot to tell us to first be nice to ourselves, then be nice to others.
